Gottes gnad und sin erbärmbd erhalte unns.

Demnach nüwe zittung von der lantzgmaind Appenzell sontag ghalten: Es habend die evangelisch gnanten für meren mögen, gott syg danck.Demnach nüwe zittung von der lantzgmaind Appenzell sontag ghalten: Es habend die evangelisch gnanten für meren mögen, gott syg danck.Es habend min herren die 5 ortt ain brieff ab dem tag Ainsidlen an die gmaind geschriben, summa der inhalt, daß ir ernstlich pitt, daß sy im land Appenzell in allen kilchhörinen, in jeder, mess halten lassend, wer der beger.Demnach nüwe zittung von der lantzgmaind Appenzell sontag ghalten: Es habend die evangelisch gnanten für meren mögen, gott syg danck.Es habend min herren die 5 ortt ain brieff ab dem tag Ainsidlen an die gmaind geschriben, summa der inhalt, daß ir ernstlich pitt, daß sy im land Appenzell in allen kilchhörinen, in jeder, mess halten lassend, wer der beger.Ist haiter abgemeret, nit zuͦ thuͦn, sonder das sy blibend ston, wi si standend, und vormals gmainden und groß rät angenomen habend etc.Demnach nüwe zittung von der lantzgmaind Appenzell sontag ghalten: Es habend die evangelisch gnanten für meren mögen, gott syg danck.Es habend min herren die 5 ortt ain brieff ab dem tag Ainsidlen an die gmaind geschriben, summa der inhalt, daß ir ernstlich pitt, daß sy im land Appenzell in allen kilchhörinen, in jeder, mess halten lassend, wer der beger.Ist haiter abgemeret, nit zuͦ thuͦn, sonder das sy blibend ston, wi si standend, und vormals gmainden und groß rät angenomen habend etc.Es hat och Berweger, der redlich, on glichsnery, gott durch in, ernstlich trutzlich ghandlett und sin helden gmuͤt, über den aptt, dess amptlüt etwas wort etlicher brucht, und die supenesser under inen bim apt inkerend, redlich antastett.Demnach nüwe zittung von der lantzgmaind Appenzell sontag ghalten: Es habend die evangelisch gnanten für meren mögen, gott syg danck.Es habend min herren die 5 ortt ain brieff ab dem tag Ainsidlen an die gmaind geschriben, summa der inhalt, daß ir ernstlich pitt, daß sy im land Appenzell in allen kilchhörinen, in jeder, mess halten lassend, wer der beger.Ist haiter abgemeret, nit zuͦ thuͦn, sonder das sy blibend ston, wi si standend, und vormals gmainden und groß rät angenomen habend etc.Es hat och Berweger, der redlich, on glichsnery, gott durch in, ernstlich trutzlich ghandlett und sin helden gmuͤt, über den aptt, dess amptlüt etwas wort etlicher brucht, und die supenesser under inen bim apt inkerend, redlich antastett.Desshalb mich nit geruwen, daß ich in oft entschulgett gegen meister Haben und ander.Demnach nüwe zittung von der lantzgmaind Appenzell sontag ghalten: Es habend die evangelisch gnanten für meren mögen, gott syg danck.Es habend min herren die 5 ortt ain brieff ab dem tag Ainsidlen an die gmaind geschriben, summa der inhalt, daß ir ernstlich pitt, daß sy im land Appenzell in allen kilchhörinen, in jeder, mess halten lassend, wer der beger.Ist haiter abgemeret, nit zuͦ thuͦn, sonder das sy blibend ston, wi si standend, und vormals gmainden und groß rät angenomen habend etc.Es hat och Berweger, der redlich, on glichsnery, gott durch in, ernstlich trutzlich ghandlett und sin helden gmuͤt, über den aptt, dess amptlüt etwas wort etlicher brucht, und die supenesser under inen bim apt inkerend, redlich antastett.Desshalb mich nit geruwen, daß ich in oft entschulgett gegen meister Haben und ander.Gott welt, daß als wenig falsch in filer hertzen steckte, als ich in im hoff.Demnach nüwe zittung von der lantzgmaind Appenzell sontag ghalten: Es habend die evangelisch gnanten für meren mögen, gott syg danck.Es habend min herren die 5 ortt ain brieff ab dem tag Ainsidlen an die gmaind geschriben, summa der inhalt, daß ir ernstlich pitt, daß sy im land Appenzell in allen kilchhörinen, in jeder, mess halten lassend, wer der beger.Ist haiter abgemeret, nit zuͦ thuͦn, sonder das sy blibend ston, wi si standend, und vormals gmainden und groß rät angenomen habend etc.Es hat och Berweger, der redlich, on glichsnery, gott durch in, ernstlich trutzlich ghandlett und sin helden gmuͤt, über den aptt, dess amptlüt etwas wort etlicher brucht, und die supenesser under inen bim apt inkerend, redlich antastett.Desshalb mich nit geruwen, daß ich in oft entschulgett gegen meister Haben und ander.Gott welt, daß als wenig falsch in filer hertzen steckte, als ich in im hoff.Ich acht och, ain prediger uß dem land, so eß gott wil, werd uff sinody zuͦ üch komen etc.
seg.output:
May God's grace and mercy preserve us. Greetings, my lord and brother, I have received your letter and thanksgiving to God for me. Thank God, who will have mercy on the end, etc.
Therefore, new news from the Appenzell country Sunday held: The evangelical people have for more power, God be thanked. Therefore, my lords, the five towns have written a letter to the country from the day Ainsidlen, the sum of the content that they earnestly pray that they will hold the Mass in every church in the Appenzell land, whoever the petitioner may be.
It has now been determined, not to do, but that they will remain, as they stand, and that the former towns and great councils have accepted etc. There was also Berweger, who behaved loyally, without hypocrisy, God through him, seriously and courageously, with his heroic courage, over the court, the officials a word of some use, and the supine under them at the court, loyally attacked.
Therefore, I do not regret that I often excuse myself against Master Haben and others. God knows how little wrong there is in my heart, as I hope in him.
I also think that a preacher from the country, as God will, will come to your synod, etc.

seg.input:
O Bulliger, ir wissend, was ich üch oft gsagt: wenn der tüffel tuͦt, als ob er tapffer sin, ob der warhait zuͦ halten, so ist er aim aller ergstenn.O Bulliger, ir wissend, was ich üch oft gsagt: wenn der tüffel tuͦt, als ob er tapffer sin, ob der warhait zuͦ halten, so ist er aim aller ergstenn.Das hand ir jetz zway drü mal im schwären gsechen.O Bulliger, ir wissend, was ich üch oft gsagt: wenn der tüffel tuͦt, als ob er tapffer sin, ob der warhait zuͦ halten, so ist er aim aller ergstenn.Das hand ir jetz zway drü mal im schwären gsechen.Dess fall alle fromen klagend und ergerend.O Bulliger, fromen klagend und ergerend.Wolhin, es ist aber überhin.O Bulliger, ir wissend, was ich üch oft gsagt: wenn der tüffel tuͦt, als ob er tapffer sin, ob der warhait zuͦ halten, so ist er aim aller ergstenn.Das hand ir jetz zway drü mal im schwären gsechen.Dess fall alle fromen klagend und ergerend.Wolhin, es ist aber überhin.Der herr uns nit drü mal lognen oder gar zuͦ schanden werden.O Bulliger, ir wissend, was ich üch oft gsagt: wenn der tüffel tuͦt, als ob er tapffer sin, ob der warhait zuͦ halten, so ist er aim aller ergstenn.Das hand ir jetz zway drü mal im schwären gsechen.Dess fall alle fromen klagend und ergerend.Wolhin, es ist aber überhin.Der herr uns nit drü mal lognen oder gar zuͦ schanden werden.Es ist warlich not, mitt großem ernst Herodianem ins angsicht zuͦ Ich hab noch nüt ferkoft; will nit gon.Ich hab noch nüt ferkoft; will nit gon.Ich bin och noch har witer onangefochten bliben, so lang gott wil.Ich hab noch nüt ferkoft; will nit gon.Ich bin och noch har witer onangefochten bliben, so lang gott wil.So erst gott wil, wil ich komen, dancken und zalen.
Min husfrow, die groß ist, dancket üch.Min husfrow, die groß ist, dancket üch.Grüst üch och mir üwer frowen, kind, den vatter, Leon und andre etc.Min husfrow, die groß ist, dancket üch.Grüst üch och mir üwer frowen, kind, den vatter, Leon und andre etc.Gott sterck üch.
Actum Santt Gallen, 30. tag aprillen anno 32 jar.
Grüsend mir meister Kaspar, den trüwen.
Üwer armer w[illiger] Hans Vogler.
An min fylgelieptten Maister Hainrich Bullingeren, prediger der statt Zürych, minem glieptten hernn und bruͦder.
seg.output:
O Bulliger, you know what I have often said to you: if the devil acts as if he is brave, if he is not true to his word, he is the worst of all. You have seen this twice now in heavy circumstances. All the pious people lament and complain of it. However, it is gone and done with. May the Lord not deceive us three times or shame us. It is indeed necessary to tell Herodianus this with great seriousness. May God protect us from the hidden plague.
I have yet to sell nothing; I do not want to go. I will remain unvanquished here for as long as God wills. When God wills it, I will come, thank and pay.
My housewife, who is great, thanks you. Greet your wives, children, father, Leon and the others etc. May God strengthen you.
Done in St. Gallen, 30th day of April in the year 32.
Greet Master Kaspar, the faithful one.
Your poor and willing Hans Vogler.
To my dear Master Hainrich Bullingeren, preacher of the city of Zurich, my dear lord and brother.

seg.output:
May God's grace and mercy keep us.
Dear Sir and Brother, I have received your letter and thanksgiving to God for me. Dear Sir and Brother, I have received your letter and thanksgiving to God for me. Thank God, who will show mercy to the end, etc.
Accordingly, new news from the country of Appenzell was held on Sunday: The Evangelicals, for the sake of greater power, thanked God. Accordingly, new news from the country of Appenzell was held on Sunday: The Evangelicals, for the sake of greater power, thanked God. My lords the five places have written a letter from the day of Ainsidlen to the country, the sum of the content, that they earnestly pray that they should keep mass in all the parish churches in each place, whoever is the petitioner. Accordingly, new news from the country of Appenzell was held on Sunday: The Evangelicals, for the sake of greater power, thanked God. My lords the five places have written a letter from the day of Ainsidlen to the country, the sum of the content, that they earnestly pray that they should keep mass in all the parish churches in each place, whoever is the petitioner. It has been determined today, not to do, but to stay, as they stand, and have been accepted by the municipalities and the great council, etc. Accordingly, new news from the country of Appenzell was held on Sunday: The Evangelicals, for the sake of greater power, thanked God. My lords the five places have written a letter from the day of Ainsidlen to the country, the sum of the content, that they earnestly pray that they should keep mass in all the parish churches in each place, whoever is the petitioner. It has been determined today, not to do, but to stay, as they stand, and have been accepted by the municipalities and the great council, etc. Berweger has also acted faithfully, without deceit, God through him, bravely defiantly, over the court, the officials have spoken some words, and the supervisors among them, standing before the court, have faithfully grasped. Accordingly, new news from the country of Appenzell was held on Sunday: The Evangelicals, for the sake of greater power, thanked God. My lords the five places have written a letter from the day of Ainsidlen to the country, the sum of the content, that they earnestly pray that they should keep mass in all the parish churches in each place, whoever is the petitioner. It has been determined today, not to do, but to stay, as they stand, and have been accepted by the municipalities and the great council, etc. Berweger has also acted faithfully, without deceit, God through him, bravely defiantly, over the court, the officials have spoken some words, and the supervisors among them, standing before the court, have faithfully grasped. Therefore, I do not regret that I have often been excused towards Master Haben and others. Accordingly, new news from the country of Appenzell was held on Sunday: The Evangelicals, for the sake of greater power, thanked God. My lords the five places have written a letter from the day of Ainsidlen to the country, the sum of the content, that they earnestly pray that they should keep mass in all the parish churches in each place, whoever is the petitioner. It has been determined today, not to do, but to stay, as they stand, and have been accepted by the municipalities and the great council, etc. Berweger has also acted faithfully, without deceit, God through him, bravely defiantly, over the court, the officials have spoken some words, and the supervisors among them, standing before the court, have faithfully grasped. Therefore, I do not regret that I have often been excused towards Master Haben and others. May God grant that as little falsehood as possible is in the hearts of the people, as I am in the court.

seg.input:
Demnach nüwe zittung von der lantzgmaind Appenzell sontag ghalten : Es habend die evangelisch gnanten für meren mögen, gott syg danck. Es habend min herren die 5 ortt ain brieff ab dem tag Ainsidlen an die gmaind geschriben, summa der inhalt, daß ir ernstlich pitt, daß sy im land Appenzell in allen kilchhörinen , in jeder, mess halten lassend, wer der beger . Ist haiter abgemeret , nit zuͦ thuͦn, sonder das sy blibend ston, wi si standend, und vormals gmainden und groß rät angenomen habend etc . Es hat och Berweger , der redlich, on glichsnery , gott durch in, ernstlich trutzlich ghandlett und sin helden gmuͤt, über den aptt , dess amptlüt etwas wort etlicher brucht, und die supenesser under inen bim apt inkerend , redlich antastett . Desshalb mich nit geruwen, daß ich in oft entschulgett gegen meister Haben und ander. Gott welt , daß als wenig falsch in filer hertzen steckte, als ich in im hoff. Ich acht och, ain prediger uß dem land, so eß gott wil, werd uff sinody zuͦ üch komen etc.
O Bulliger, ir wissend, was ich üch oft gsagt: wenn der tüffel tuͦt, als ob er tapffer sin, ob der warhait zuͦ halten , so ist er aim aller ergstenn. O Bulliger, ir wissend, was ich üch oft gsagt: wenn der tüffel tuͦt, als ob er tapffer sin, ob der warhait zuͦ halten , so ist er aim aller ergstenn. Das hand ir jetz zway drü mal im schwären gsechen. Das hand ir jetz zway drü mal im schwären gsechen. Dess fall alle fromen klagend und ergerend. Das hand ir jetz zway drü mal im schwären gsechen. Dess fall alle fromen klagend und ergerend. Wolhin, es ist aber überhin . Das hand ir jetz zway drü mal im schwären gsechen. Dess fall alle fromen klagend und ergerend. Wolhin, es ist aber überhin . Der herr uns nit drü mal lognen oder gar zuͦ schanden werden. Das hand ir jetz zway drü mal im schwären gsechen. Dess fall alle fromen klagend und ergerend. Wolhin, es ist aber überhin . Der herr uns nit drü mal lognen oder gar zuͦ schanden werden. Es ist warlich not, mitt großem ernst Herodianem ins angsicht zuͦ sagen . O Bulliger, ir wissend, was ich üch oft gsagt: wenn der tüffel tuͦt, als ob er tapffer sin, ob der warhait zuͦ halten , so ist er aim aller ergstenn. Das hand ir jetz zway drü mal im schwären gsechen. Dess fall alle fromen klagend und ergerend. Wolhin, es ist aber überhin . Der herr uns nit drü mal lognen oder gar zuͦ schanden werden. Es ist warlich not, mitt großem ernst Herodianem ins angsicht zuͦ sagen . Gott bhuͤt uns vor der haimlichen pestilentz .
Ich hab noch nüt ferkoft; will nit gon . Ich hab noch nüt ferkoft; will nit gon . Ich bin och noch har witer onangefochten bliben, so lang gott wil. Ich hab noch nüt ferkoft; will nit gon . Ich bin och noch har witer onangefochten bliben, so lang gott wil. So erst gott wil, wil ich komen, dancken und zalen.
Min husfrow , die groß ist, dancket üch. Min husfrow , die groß ist, dancket üch. Grüst üch och mir üwer frowen , kind, den vatter , Leon und andre etc. Min husfrow , die groß ist, dancket üch. Grüst üch och mir üwer frowen , kind, den vatter , Leon und andre etc. Gott sterck üch.
Actum Santt Gallen , 30. tag aprillen anno 32 jar.
Grüsend mir meister Kaspar , den trüwen.
Üwer armer w[illiger] Hans Vogler .
An min fylgelieptten Maister Hainrich Bullingeren, prediger der statt Zürych, minem glieptten hernn und bruͦder.
seg.output:
According to the new newspaper of the canton Appenzell, Sunday was held: The Evangelicals, thanks be to God, had the five places write a letter from the day Ainsidlen to the canton, the sum of the contents being that they earnestly begged that they should hold services in all the churches in every parish, whoever was the petitioner. It was now agreed, not to do it, but that they should remain standing, as they had done and what the parish and great council had accepted, etc. There was also Berweger, who, with God as his guide, acted earnestly and faithfully and with his heroic spirit, beyond the office of his office, some words were spoken by some of them and the officers among them, faithfully attacked the court. Therefore, I do not regret that I often excused myself to Master Haben and others. God knows that there was as little wrong in the hearts of the people as I thought in the court. I also think that a preacher from the country, if it is God's will, will come to the synod, etc.
O Bullinger, you know what I have often said to you: when the devil does as if he were brave to keep the truth, he is the worst of all. You have now seen this twice and three times in the worst. O Bullinger, you know what I have often said to you: when the devil does as if he were brave to keep the truth, he is the worst of all. You have now seen this twice and three times in the worst. Therefore all the pious lament and regret. O Bullinger, you know what I have often said to you: when the devil does as if he were brave to keep the truth, he is the worst of all. You have now seen this twice and three times in the worst. Therefore all the pious lament and regret. Well, it is, however, too late. O Bullinger, you know what I have often said to you: when the devil does as if he were brave to keep the truth, he is the worst of all. You have now seen this twice and three times in the worst. Therefore all the pious lament and regret. Well, it is, however, too late. May the Lord not lie to us three times or even be ashamed. O Bullinger, you know what I have often said to you: when the devil does as if he were brave to keep the truth, he is the worst of all. You have now seen this twice and three times in the worst. Therefore all the pious lament and regret. Well, it is, however, too late. May the Lord not lie to us three times or even be ashamed. It is indeed necessary, with great earnestness, to tell Herodianes to his face. O Bullinger, you know what I have often said to you: when the devil does as if he were brave to keep the truth, he is the worst of all. You have now seen this twice and three times in the worst. Therefore all the pious lament and regret. Well, it is, however, too late. May the Lord not lie to us three times or even be ashamed. It is indeed necessary, with great earnestness, to tell Herodianes to his face. May God protect us from the secret plague.
I have not sold anything yet; I will not go. I have not sold anything yet; I will not go. I will also remain unharmed as long as God wills. I have not sold anything yet; I will not go. I will also remain unharmed as long as God wills. Then, if God wills, I will come, thank and pay.
My wife, who is great, thanks you. My wife, who is great, thanks you. Greet also your wives, children, the father, Leon and others, etc. My wife, who is great, thanks you. Greet also your wives, children, the father, Leon and others, etc. God strengthen you.
Act Santt Gallen, 30th day of April, in the year 32.
Greet Master Kaspar, the faithful.
To my beloved Master Henry Bullinger, preacher of the city of Zurich, my beloved lord and brother.
